bug.short_desc: antimony hangs when it does not find supported OpenGL

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: I don't know if this is something worth fixing, so I'm just throwing this out here for your consideration:
$ ssh -X rawhide $ antimony libGL error: failed to open drm device: Permission denied libGL error: failed to load driver: nouveau libGL error: failed to create dri screen libGL error: failed to load driver: swrast Unrecognized OpenGL version Unrecognized OpenGL version ^C ^C ^C
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): antimony-0.9.0-0.5.20151111git12e9f8.fc24.x86_64

This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 24 development cycle. Changing version to '24'.
More information and reason for this action is here: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Fedora_Program_Management/HouseKeeping/Fedora24#Rawhide_Rebase
Can you test new build, please ? http://koji.fedoraproject.org/koji/buildinfo?buildID=768302
Now it just hangs, no messages.
